custodhist.head: Provenance
custodhist.p: Letter and proofs removed from Rare Book Division copy of Sinclair Lewis: A Biographical Sketchby Carl Van Doren, with a bibliography by Harvey Taylor [Barrett PS3523.E94Z9 1933]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: This collection contains a letter from Sinclair Lewis to Jacob Blanck, 1941 October 10, concerning the proofs of a bibliography of his work compiled by Harvey Taylor. He objects to the inclusion of two spurious works by Taylor, a secretary whom he dismissed, and to "Half a Loaf" by Grace Hegger Lewis, which he claims not to have read. Also included in the collection are the bibliography page proofs.

did.unittitle: Sinclair Lewis, "The Warwick," New York, New York, to Jacob Blanck, 1941 Oct 10

scopecontent.p: Regarding the proofs of a bibliography of his work and making objections to certain items signed and numbered by Harvey Taylor, as well as the inclusion of Half a Loaf.
